result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda R. Sabatke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling as determined by agent.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Assessment, treatment, counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  

AODA and recommended follow through.

records.addlTxt: from DOC requesting review of sentence credit.

Clerk Nikki; 
Case called: 1:34 pm.
INCLUDES: 19CM1330, 15CF1171, 16CF834, 16CF837, 17CF436, 17CF1219, 18CF54.
State appears by ADA Davis Runde; Defendant appears in custody w/Atty Thomas Roley.
Date and time set for plea in 19CM1330; and Sentencing on revocation on ALL other files.

PLEA IN 19CM1330:
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
PLEA to Ct 1 (OWI 3rd) >> NO CONTEST.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & defendant guilty;
COURT ORDERS: SWH for 2 years probation; 
CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; Maintain absolute sobriety; No entering bars, taverns, or liquor stores; AODA assessment and follow through; Pay fine of $3,256; 105 days jail; Comply with D/L plan; 30 month D/L revocation; 30 month IID; 6 points reduction from D/L.
PROBATION TO RUN CONSECUTIVE AFTER THE PRISON SENTENCE.

SENTENCING HEARING ON REVOCATION IN 15CF1171, 16CF834, 16CF837, 17CF436, 17CF1219, 18CF54:
Parties have reached a joint agreement.
Sentencing in 15CF1171, 16CF834, 16CF837, 17CF436, 18CF54: >> 3 years prison; 2 years IC, 1 year ES.
Sentencing in 17CF1219 >> 2 1/2 years prison; 18 months IC, 1 year ES.
CONDITIONS OF ES: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; Maintain absolute sobriety.
ALL PRISON SENTENCES ARE TO RUN CONCURRENT TO EACH OTHER.
COURT grants 168 days credit each in 15CF1171 and 16CF837.
COURT grants 175 days credit in 16CF834.
COURT grants 170 days credit in 17CF436.
COURT grants 172 days credit in 17CF1219.
COURT grants 42 days credit in 18CF54.
Defendant eligible for SAP/CIP.
Defendant is remanded to Sheriff's Dept for transport to Prison System.

Stip SAR and Plea 11/25/19 @ 1:30pm
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 6, 2019 at 08:45 am.
